Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of Delegate's decision on H&C application
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mr. Figueroa's past membership in an organization deemed to engage in terrorism, non-combatant role, family ties, community contributions
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application denied based on security grounds
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review under s 72(1) of IRPA
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Decision found unreasonable; case remitted for reconsideration by a different officer
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant for permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Delegate focused solely on security risk without balancing H&C factors
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged inadmissibility on security grounds despite strong humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard requiring deference unless decision is outside acceptable range
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Balance between national security concerns and humanitarian factors
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of transparency and inadequate reasoning in decision-making process
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Evidence of membership in FMLN, personal circumstances, family and community ties
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residency
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and extent of organizational involvement, individual role, duration of residence, family connections
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Granting of permanent residency through H&C consideration
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider relevant evidence regarding non-combatant status and positive integration
Crimes.Outcome: Judicial review granted, decision set aside, matter remitted
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of separation from family and community in Canada
Crimes.Cause_Description: Denial of H&C application due to security-related inadmissibility despite compelling humanitarian factors
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Insufficient analysis and weighing of favorable evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 72(1) procedural fairness and reasonableness requirements
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Selective use of evidence focusing only on security risk
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Long-term presence and integration in Canadian society
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and unbalanced evaluation of submitted materials
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Overemphasis on security inadmissibility without proportionate assessment of H&C factors
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of transparency and justification in evaluating key evidence

Crimes.Crime_Name: Membership in an organization engaging in terrorism
Crimes.National_Security_Element: Alleged membership in FMLN, designated as engaging in terrorist activity
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Perceived threat based on association with armed conflict-era organization
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Evaluation of Mr. Figueroa’s role as non-combatant political activist
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Past affiliation with organization involved in armed conflict
Crimes.Target_Entity: Government or societal stability concerns related to foreign organizations
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Acknowledged membership during civil conflict period in El Salvador
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Non-violent political participation, no evidence of violent acts
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Failure to distinguish between combatant and non-combatant roles within the organization
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible evidence presented of limited, non-violent involvement
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistency of testimony, supporting documentation, lack of contradictory evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Evidence of non-combatant role not adequately considered
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Disregard of exculpatory evidence showing minimal risk
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities in immigration inadmissibility assessments
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA provisions on inadmissibility for security reasons
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to inadmissibility due to association with terrorist organizations
Crimes.Governing_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Division 4 – Inadmissibility
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Finding of inadmissibility based on organizational membership
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of permanent residency on security grounds
Crimes.Outcome: Court found decision unreasonable; remitted for re-evaluation
Crimes.Process: Humanitarian and compassionate application process under IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Obligation to provide transparent, justified, and balanced decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to address all relevant factors in H&C assessment
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Lack of meaningful engagement with mitigating humanitarian factors
Crimes.Judicial_Review_Outcome: Judicial review granted, decision quashed, matter remitted
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Insufficient explanation and imbalance in factor weighing
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: Potential removal if permanent residency denied
